title: (x) Dallas Mavericks logo - TF Cavalier A Bold {Yves}
author: Tom Cannon

comments.content: The font I am trying to find is the same as the "sacremento kings" font--I answered my own question---it is Narrowband Prime ICG. The font came with Illustrator but I don't know who sells it.
And I just finished creating my own version of the font because I couldn't find it. Rats.

BTW It's not Narrowband Prime ICG, it's [Treacyfaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621160906/http:/www.treacyfaces.com/)'   
 [TF Cavalier A Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621160906/http:/www.treacyfaces.com/sample.html), a face originally designed by   
Sylvester A. Cypress in 1992-94.   
   
 ![sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621160906im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/10674.jpg)

I _love_ my [FontBook](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621160906/http:/fontshop.com/virtual/index.cfm?area=SF_products&subarea=SF_products_fontbook): 5 years old, but still the   
best thing around. It simply can't be beat.

Your assumption that it was Narrowband Prime ICG set   
me on the wrong foot. It's only afterwards I decided   
to check the Narrowband character set from up close.   
Sorry I was late. :/
